intro: Haplodiscus graveolens, commonly known as the stinking vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplodiscus graveolens is often found in moist, shaded areas and can be invasive in certain environments.
